replies.bodyText: As discussed out of band of this PR, there are complications with building a docker image to allow for a run of confluent cli or the ak tools and installing the tools has it's own burden on users.  In addition, asking a user to run docker run --it --rm confluentinc/confluent-cli -arg1 -arg 2 doesn't feel (IMO) any more streamlined than the docker exec solution we have here now.  Are we ok leaving this as is for now until another solution is found?
replies.author: rspurgeon

replies.bodyText:
Another option is to have the user open a shell on the container and exercise the tutorial that way:
docker-compose exec broker bash
root@broker:/# kafka-topics --create --topic example-topic --zookeeper zookeeper:2181 --replication-factor 1 --partitions 1
Created topic example-topic.
root@broker:/# kafka-console-consumer --topic example-topic --bootstrap-server broker:9092
the
lazy
fox
jumped over the brown cow
^CProcessed a total of 4 messages

This would require the student to open 2 termainals and exec broker bash into both of them; however, we require them to open two terminals now so maybe this wouldn't be too big of a burden.
docker-compose exec broker bash
root@broker:/# kafka-console-producer --topic example-topic --broker-list broker:9092
>the
>lazy
>fox
>jumped over the brown cow
>^Croot@broker:/# kafka-console-producer --topic example-topic --broker-list broker:9092
>how now
brown cow
all streams lead
to Kafka!>>>
